bioghist.p: Robert B. Wolf was born in Newark, Delaware, and educated at the University of Delaware. Wolf was a director of the National Bureau of Economic Research, the American Paper and Pulp Association, and the New York Merchants Association, of which he was chairman of its Industrial Relations Committee. Wolf was the manager of the Pulp Division of the Weyerhaeuser Timber Company (retired in 1947, after which he did consulting) and a specialist in labor-management relations.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Robert B. Wolf that span the dates 1910-1952. Materials include: incoming and outgoing letters to figures in industry, government, and trade unions (both individual unions and federations); typescript and printed addresses on issues related to business and labor; and biographical information on Wolf. Correspondents include Florence Thorne and William Green of the American Federation of Labor. The collection also includes subject files on the war scare, and notable figures of the time, including H.G. Wells, Hitler, Walter Lippmann, and Frances Perkins.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
